intro: Malouetia molongo, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
